reviews.review_msg: awww he has improved his teaching skill :) and I would say now he is the best math prof at sfu as I think:)he did a great job with math 254, which is engineering math course and he made it as easy as a piece of cake, although before taking the course i heard it's very hard course..but Ralf rocks and made it very reasonable.Great prof :)

Very good prof. He was very good at teaching complicated topics. Lectures were quite useful. Lots of homework (10 hours per week usually), but this is good for practice. Midterm was very long, but final was good length and both were a fair difficulty level. Course material is quite useful, but it repeats quite a bit from MATH 251.

Great prof!! Long exams but fair. If you learn everything and understand the concepts you will do well. His hw is long, but if you do the assignments and don't copy, you'll barely need to study for the final. Great prof, recommend him for any math course.
His notes are messy but the exams are easy and straight forward, he is funny sometimes, lectures are not boring, and i think he doesnt like teaching at all!!! o btw he is HOT
The lectures can be disorganized, but reading the textbook and using resources like unstuckstudy ai helped me stay on top of the material. Overall, a challenging yet rewarding course.
Lectures were so useless it was basically just random derivations that he felt like he wanted to show the class.
Never ever go to lectures. They won't prepare you for the midterms or the final.
I stopped going to lectures after the first midterm and it was the best decision I could have made. I think I would fail the course if I went to lectures. Very bad explanations and useless tutorials.

This is the second class I've had with Dr. Jungic (I also had him for calculus 3) and it's been a terrible experience overall. Just really disorganized lectures and confusing explanations. I did much better this time by just reading the textbook and not going to his classes.
Not a real teacher, he just loves to show off in class with derivations that he ends up screwing up anyways. I'm glad I never have to take courses with him again.
Happy retirement Dr. J! The Passionate lecture will always remind me purpose of studying.
He is an amazing professor. Midterm exams are hard but will help you succeed in the course and do well in the final.  My favourite professor at SFU so far

This is for MATH 260. Choi is a really good prof. His accent is hard to understand at first, but once you get used to it, his explanations are actually great. Definitely in the upper tier of math profs I've had so far! Quizzes are very fair, seems to care for students' success.

Fair lectures, but he sometimes goes too fast or writes too messily. In exam review lectures, he tells you exactly what he expects you to know on the exam, and will only test on stuff mentioned in the review lectures. The midterms were fair in difficulty, but the final was hard. Some of the quizzes may blindside you, so beware of those.
